results.title: Obelia
results.brief_description: A straightforward presentation of the form and mode of life of Obelia. The colonies of hydranths are seen to develop blasto-styles and the emergence of the medusae is shown by rapid-motion photography. Emphasis is laid on the alternation of generations.

results.title: Obedience
results.brief_description: Documents probably one of the most important social psychological experiments ever designed. The film records Dr Stanley Milgram’s experiments at Yale on obedience to authority: an attempt to determine how a person reacts when asked to carry out orders that conflict with their conscience. Subjects are shown administering electric shocks to another person as penalties for mistakes in learning.

results.title: Oasis in space: what price progress?
results.creator_credit: Andrew W Sott, Andrew Solt Productions, Costeau Society Production and Philippe Cousteau
results.brief_description: Affects of pollution (asbestos) on drinking water in area of Silver bay in US. Goes through how they analyse content of water and methods of how to reverse the situation of environmental disaster. Narrator, Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: visions of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Corporation, Andrew Solt Productions, Cousteau Society, Andrew Solt and Philippe Cousteau
results.brief_description:
Discussion of technological and scientific developments which lead to predictions of what the future may be like. Concentrates on the history of the Space Age - space flight, astronomy, scientific innovations, the effect of space technology on Earth’s economic development; marine life and the preservation of endangered species.
Narrated by Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: population time-bomb
results.brief_description: Discussion of world growth and how this affects economy, health, wealth and social conditions of world communities. Focuses on exponential growth, discussing the fast growth rate of the world; developing world countries affected by poverty, covering different viewpoints and theories; historical and political uprisings such as El Salvador etc. Discuses the methods of overcoming population growth in poorer countries through education and health. Different view points are expressed including those of: Dr Margaret Mead, Carl Sagan. Paul Ehrlich, Isaac Asimov and Yves Cousteau.

results.title: O.H.M.S.: royal visit to Australia 1963
results.brief_description: The royal visit of the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh to all Australian states in 1963. Shows a respresentative selection of the engagements undertaken by the Royal couple, and the behind the scenes activities of the Australian Post Office related to the visit. Also shows some good archival footage of the “south bank” area in Melbourne before the complex was developed. Narrated by T. Horton.

results.title: O dreamland
results.brief_description: One of the first films in the Free Cinema movement in British documentary production, Lindsay Anderson offers an insight into the British working class culture. Margate Amusement Park is depicted less a site of innocent levity than of vicarious sadism and quiet desperation. This observation of proletarian entertainment becomes as much a testament to the failure of Atlee’s social democracy as Orwell’s “1984”. A powerful film.

results.title: Nylon goes to work
results.creator_credit: Harold Goodwin, Film Producers Guild, British Nylon Spinners and R.Q. McNaughton
results.brief_description: Nylon is used for some of the toughest jobs in British industry. This film takes twelve examples to illustrate some of the material’s unique characteristics, ranging from nylon rope, such as that used to haul Thames barges, to the use of the material in fire hoses and the tyres of aircraft.
